item.title: Pollution | SMG recommend to the population to avoid going out on the street
item.description:
The high concentrations of pollutants in the air throughout yesterday led the authorities to alert the population to avoid going out on the street or practicing outdoor exercise
Macao's displaced dust for a northeast monsoon led the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) to appeal to the population to avoid leaving home. Throughout the day, air quality levels were varying, but for most of the time they remained at levels classified as dangerous. "Under the influence of a dust storm brought by a northeast monsoon, and due to weak wind and unfavorable meteorological conditions for the dispersion of atmospheric pollutants, it is expected that the concentration of pollutants will remain at high levels for a period of time," SMGs were explained by the alerts issued to the population. "SMG advise the population, especially people who suffer from heart or respiratory disease, pregnant, children and the elderly, to avoid strenuous activities and outdoor activities, especially in areas of intense traffic," he was added. Regarding the general population, around noon, it was indicated to reduce “strenuous activities and the time of outdoor permanence”. According to the authorities' analysis, the different pollutants recorded different levels of concentration throughout the day, a factor that also depends on the place where the measurement is made. However, around 12:35 pm, the concentration of particles 2.5, also known as fine particles, ranged from 74 to 81 micrograms per cubic meter. The World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines indicate that healthy levels of PM2..5 should not be above an average of 5 microgram per cubic meter throughout the year. In addition, the WHO indicates daily exposure to a value of 15 microgram per cubic meter, should not exceed more than four days. High values Regarding PM10 particles, around 12:35 pm, concentration levels ranged from 272 to 368 micrograms per cubic meter. According to WHO, the healthy limit value of the average daily concentration of these particles is 50 micrograms per cubic meter and the annual limitation value is 20 micrograms per cubic meter. At the level of nitrogen dioxide the recommended maximum levels are 25 micrograms per cubic meter per day and 10 micrograms per cubic meter per year. The measurement of SMG at 12:35 pm yesterday, which was based on the values ​​of the previous hour, indicated a concertation of 39.1 to 88.9 micrograms per cubic meter. It was not only at Misrem that the impact of the dusts displaced by the monsoon was felt. Yesterday morning, Hong Kong appeared identified by the portal IQAIR.com as the place with the fourth worst concentration of air pollutants worldwide. Raehk was only outdated at the worst air quality level by Shenzhen, the neighboring city of the interior of China, Nova Deli in India and Lahore, Pakistan. Around noon, Hong Kong fell to sixth place, having been overtaken by the Chinese cities of Guangzhou and Chongqing, which also had a large concentration of pollutants in the air.

item.title: COVER CLASS | Sam hu fai expects “consensus” to decide
item.description:
There may be changes in the pecuniary reimbursement program, but it is not known when or how. Sam Hou Fai said it was necessary more consensus in society, but indicated that part of the budget value for the check can be applied to the local economy
The pecuniary reimbursement program will be changed, but Sam Hou Fai was no use yesterday, at the Press Conference on the Governing Action Lines Report (LAG) for this year, no details on what this change will be, regarding formats, values ​​and if residents living outside Macao will continue to receive support. In order to know what will happen is necessary consensus, he said. "I can't respond more detailed about the [check assignment] conditions. At this time, the government's goal is to give 10,000 patacas to permanent residents and 6,000 for non-permanent. For more details I have to have the consensus of society," he said. Sam Hou Fai left, however, some considerations about any formats to be adopted by the authorities. "We have been this plan for 17 years, and if we keep it in old format, or if it will be necessary to reform, it depends on the consensus we get in society. We can deposit the money in the bank or use a certain amount to inject the economy, so that it will be more dependent on the real life situation." The chief executive pointed out that, in budgetary terms, “this year will not be easy”, as “very high regular expenses, of 150 billion, and tax revenues of the game of the order of 93.1 billion are foreseen. In addition, the ruler recalled the highest stability of the current inflation rate in 2008, when the pecuniary reimbursement program was created. "I remember that in 2008 the financial crisis and the inflation rate were issues faced at the time. The inflation rate was 9.4 percent, but now it is more relieved. The pecuniary checks are a measure of support and not regulated by law. In society there have been voices that this plan has a part that is not fair and has to change," he said. “Because it is an annual measure, it is necessary to launch the administrative regulation, and if not released, it is a sign that there will be no cash checks. "There is a slowdown due to economic adjustment after pandemic and the price of housing in neighboring regions. We will not plan to resume the works, because economic housing is something that is related to the supply of land and the private market. assured. We can encourage the creation of more flights to these countries." "I was told that there was no change in the administrative regulation, and I noticed that, according to the Basic Law, the rights remain unchanged. We have Portuguese jurists working in the government and doctors, and also at the Portuguese Macao School there are teachers. We have no problem."

item.title: AL | Sam Hou Fai launches support for birth, but warns for budget revenues
item.description:
In his first lines of government action, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new “childhood subsidy” that will assign up to 18,000 patacas per year to permanent residents under three years. However, it warned of economic difficulties
In the first lines and government action he presented to the population of Macau, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new childhood allowance that will assign a maximum and 18,000 patacas per year to children under three years. In the Legislative Assembly, the Chief Executive revealed the creation of a new social support and the updating of others, underlined that the government places the well-being of the population as the great priority. Although it has only mentioned the “mitigation of population concerns” such as the third priority of the government's policies, behind other aspects such as the diversification of the economy and the efficiency of governance in the MSAR, Sam ensured that the population is the first priority: “The well-being of the population is fundamental. This government will persist in placing the interests of the population first and, taking into account the subjects related to their daily life, to solve the real problems. More pressing, with a view to responding to their aspirations for a quality life, ”he promised. As part of this policy, Sam Hou Fai has announced the support changes that are mainly intended to promote the increase in the birth rate and to support the elderly population or with special needs. At birth, the big news was the creation of the “childhood assistance subsidy” that will assign to each permanent resident child up to three years old an amount of 1,500 patacas per month, which can reach a maximum of 18 thousand patacas per year. This incentive is added an increase of 1,082 patacas from the birth subsidy, which rises from current 5,418 patacas to 6,500 patacas. Also the marriage subsidy is increased by 78 patacas, 2,122 patacas to 2,220 patacas. For the elderly At the level of support for the elderly, the elderly subsidy is increased by 1,000 patacas, rising from the maximum annual amount of 9,000 to 10,000 patacas. At the same time, the pension for the elderly is updated from a monthly amount of 3,740 per month to 3,900 patacas per month, a difference of 160 patacas per month. As this pension is paid thirteen times throughout the year, the maximum amount rises 2,080 patacas, from current 48,620 patacas to 50,700 patacas. Regarding residents with disability, normal allowance will be increased to 10,000 patacas per year, compared to current 9,000 patacas. The special disability allowance has a larger increase from the current 18,000 patacas to 20,000 patacas, a difference of 2,000 patacas. Outra das novidades é uma actualização dos vales de saúde, que vai subir para 700 patacas, quando actualmente são de 600 patacas. Economics warnings At the economy level, although without ever mentioning the new trade war between the United States and China, the chief executive warned that the Economy of the MSAR will not pass unscathed, although it can count on the interior market. "We have witnessed, in recent years, the aggravation of unilateralism and protectionism, the insufficiency of dynamics prone to world economic growth, as well as the increase of unforeseen events and uncertainties," he said. "Deep and complex changes in the internal and external environment have already manifested and will persist, so Macau, as a microeconomic strongly turned outside, could not be immune to the resulting impacts," he added. "For all this, we should not underestimate any threats and challenges, before, we must always be aware of the risks and a sense of warning, so that we are prepared to act against all potential threats," he warned. Sam Hou Fai also acknowledged that the current revenues are below the expected and that there may be a need to have a reformulation of the mashed budget in force. In terms of economy support, the government leader has announced a bank credit interest bonus plan for small and medium enterprises, which will allow entrepreneurs to obtain up to 4 percent of loan interest rates for three years, a maximum of 5 million patacas. The maximums of bonusted total loans cannot exceed 10 billion patacas. Checks with “Requirements” In yesterday's presentation, Sam Hou Fai said that the amounts paid in the pecuniary checks will remain, ensuring that the pecuniary reimbursement program should be changed, without being announced which. "After the hell of the opinions of all sectors of the company, the improvement of a monetary regime will be performed, using savings in expenses to increase the welfare of residents and promote the development of the community economy." In the same session it was mentioned that the money is attributed to residents “who meet the requirements”, so it remains to know what these requirements will be. Focus on terrorism In the lag presented yesterday by Sam Hou Fai National Security had a lower prominence in the face of the speeches of Ho IAT SENG. Still, it has been indicated that for this year the reformulation of the State Security Defense Commission will be studied and new laws will be thought of to combat terrorism. In the context of nationalism, framed in the chapter of national security, it was explained that the government will further support associations considered as patriotic, while events will be organized to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the War Victory against Japan. Cash reform At the public administration level, the Chief Executive announced that he will submit a proposal to reformulate the Institute for Municipal Affairs. The bill must enter the Legislative Assembly by the end of the year. The changes have not been detailed, but the great goal is to "simplify the organic structure of the government and raise the efficiency of its functioning." Also the Directorate of Administration and Public Services will be reformulated this year. In addition, Sam Hou Fai has promised that civil servants will begin to oath loyalty. item.title: Encounter | Apomac without hope of seeing problems solved
item.description:
The President of the Apomac General Assembly, Jorge Fão, received José Cesário, Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities, but admits that problems such as the extension of passports to 10 years or the implementation of an effective system to do the life will continue without solution
The President of the General Assembly of Apomac - Association of Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners of Macao claims to have no hope of solving the problems of the Portuguese in Macau related to the consulate, proof of life or extension of the validity of passports. This is how Jorge Fão commented yesterday's meeting with the Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities, José Cesário. "He [Cesário] knows what our concerns are, but they are not resolved, because Portugal has a very weak economy, not a rich country, and the Portuguese living outside Portugal, and especially outside Europe, have dies of problems. And Portugal cannot solve these problems," Jorge Fão told HM when asked about the presentation of the problems of the Portuguese community. "He knows the problems better than anyone, worked many mandates as deputy and secretary of state, knows better than any secretary of state the situation. But, the problems have been solved so far?" He asked. Jorge Fão recognized that he lost hope after successive governments of Portugal. "I never hope to solve the problems. I have already lost the desire to wait, in fact I lost confidence, faith and lost everything," he admitted. "Whoever, I think Portugal is very turned in and out, the Portuguese from Macau, Canada or Brazil, or wherever, just to acquire the nationality takes years. If there is a Portuguese child born abroad, to acquire Portuguese nationality only the procedure takes three years," he exemplified.
With “beards” The associative leader explained that the problems with greater impact go through the waiting time in the processes of recognition of Portuguese nationality, the increase in the validity of the passport from five to 10 years, the proof of life for the reformed that does not work and always has to be repeated, a “old -fashioned” computer system in the consulate of Portugal, as well as lack of personnel and wage updates to the workers of the consulate. Jorge Fão guarantees that these problems mentioned yesterday at the meeting with José Cesário, but were not new. "These problems have all beards," he said. In turn, the secretary, according to Fão, left no promises of resolution: "He does not promise, because he knows what the situation is like. How will he make promises if this is not just about him?" He said. "When a government does not work, it cannot be expected to be a secretary of state to work the rest," he said. With Portugal having new elections for the Assembly of the Republic on May 18, and with José Cesário leading the AD list, currently in power, in the circle outside of Europe, Fão indicated that the matter was little approached, but that he did not fail to tell Cesário that he considers him favorite. "He has not touched much in his [electoral] program, but I think he is prepared for what comes from the electoral act. I think he is convinced that he will win, and probably will," he said. "I am not seeing the existence of another strong competitor. To this day it has not yet appeared," he said.

item.title: Press | AJM concerned with lack of communication
item.description:
The Macao Journalists Association indicates that Sam Hou Fai has implemented a new communication model, which is essentially from preventing the rulers from being the target of questions by the media
The Macao Journalists Association (AJM) is concerned about Sam Hou Fai's policy and communication, which accuses that "significantly reduced the number of opportunities for journalists to directly interview the chief executive, secretaries and other rulers." The position was taken through a statement issued yesterday, where it is pointed out that 90 percent of government information result from communications, without any chance of raising questions. "AJM is seriously concerned about the fact that such a passive and regressive communication approach can become the new normal," he was nominated. “Once again, we appeal to the Government of Misrem that honor his promise of respect for press freedom, taking concrete measures: dialogue with the public and the media with more confidence, so that the community has a better understanding of their policy and vision,” was asked. AJM also regrets that journalists have ceased to be invited to cover some events that were normally covered, such as official visits to the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao, or traditional visits by the Chief Executive during the fourth day of the Lunar New Year. In relation to the latter, the association indicates that the government only invited “two media” with connections close to the executive. Irrational refusal In the statement, the AJM also addresses the situation of the media in places that are being barred from the press conferences organized by the government. "The government continues to refuse, irrationally, that local monthly magazines and the media in line make it covered some types of official events. Namely, these exclusions often occur at events involving high employees," he was criticized. “The Social Communication Office has been trying to justify these discriminatory practices with unconvincing explanations, such as the 'limited space' available at various event places to accommodate the press, and even advised journalists to 'watches the event' transmission 'instead of personally attending. Such answers raise serious doubts about the integrity of employees and their understanding of the role of journalism, and reflect a lack of knowledge of the rules, International for an open government, eventually undermining the credibility and public image of the MSAR, ”was defended. The Association thus asks the Executive to respect the Press Law: “AJM reiterates that what journalists need is neither discourses nor pressuated press, but of adequate mechanisms for performing reports on site, where journalists can listen to the voices of all stakeholders, interact directly with the decision makers and obtain a clear understanding of the logic and guidance of current public policies”, was published.

item.title: Music | Sound bands of Hayao Miyazaki classics live on Londoner
item.description:
Yoshikazu Mera, Azumi Inoue and Yu-Yu Imao will play Joe Hisaishi's works composed for the movies "The Mononoke Princesses", "My neighbor Totoro" and "Castle in the Heaven." The concert will also celebrate the 40th anniversary of the debut of “Nausicaä do Vale do Véra”
Os fãs do realizador Hayao Miyazaki, do compositor Joe Hisaishi e do estúdio de animação Ghibli vão ter a oportunidade de ouvir ao vivo as principais músicas dos filmes “A Princesas Mononoke”, “O Meu Vizinho Totoro” e “Castelo no Céu”. The Studio Ghibli Symphony concert is scheduled for April 26, Saturday, at the Arena of the Hotel and Casino Londoner. The group of 18 musicians coming from Japan will be accompanied by the original singers of the soundtracks of the Japanese director. One of the main highlights is Contractor Yoshikazu Mera, who at 53 is one of Japan's best -known Western classical music singers. For this media, he contributed the fact that in 1997 he was chosen to sing the soundtrack of the movie “The Mononoke Princesses”, and especially the theme “Mononoke Hime”, made up of Joe Hisaishi. Azumi Inoue will be another of the Japanese stars taking the Londoner stage. The singer has gained great notoriety in the Japanese country with the songs "Sanpo" and "My Neighbor Totoro" of the 1988 film. The two songs served as opening and closing themes of the movie that saw the character Totoro became so iconic, and easily recognized, which joined the logo of animated studio Ghibli, founded by Miyazaki. In recent years, Azumi Inoue has been doing several performances with her daughter, Yu-Yu Imao, a duet that will be repeated in Macau. The three singers also join the actress Sumi Shimamoto, who throughout a career, with several decades, giving voices to some of the main characters of Japanese animations, had as one of the highest points the interpretation of Nausicaä, in the "Nausicaä of the Vale do Vale", also performed by Hayao Miyazaki. Among the 18 musicians is also the presence of violinist Takeshi Hashima, also known as Ken Hashima, the lead violinist of the Tokyo Asia orchestra. Night and birthday In addition to the musical celebration, the concert organizers will also mark the 40th anniversary of the movie “Nausicaä do Vale do Vale”, opened in 1984 in Japan. This film marked the beginning of Miyazaki's collaboration with composer Joe Hisaishi, who lasted to this day and was highly the movie “Travel of Chihiro” (2001). This was Miyazaki's first film to attract true world attention, namely with the entry into the US market, which allowed him to assert himself as the greatest figures of animation cinema. Tickets for the concert are on sale on the Venetian dealers' platform, which explores Londoner, as well as on Macauticket, and range from 380 to 980 patacas.

item.title: South Korea | Former President denies insurrection
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol denied yesterday having committed any insurrection acting during the attempt to impose martial law in December "To describe an event that lasted just a few hours, which was not violent, and immediately agree to describe the request for dissolution of the National Assembly as an insurrection (…) it seems legally unfounded," he said before the central court of Seoul, which after two preliminary hearings began to judge the case, which could result in a Yoon Suk Yeol conviction or even the death penalty. Untited by the Constitutional Court on April 4, after being suspended from office in mid -December, Yoon now faces criminal accusations. Despite the heavy penalties to which he was subject, he is free, and his pre-trial detention was annulled by procedural reasons on March 8. Like all defendants, the former head of state had to start by saying his name, date of birth and home. The incriminating accusation Yoon Suk Yeol of “wanting to provoke a revolt, with the aim of overthrowing the constitutional order”, noting that the martial law was prepared in advance and that orders were given to the army to cut electricity and depart the parliament windows. Yoon, former Attorney General, elected head of state in 2022, began to refute the point charges by point. Most experts expect the process to be long, making comparisons with former President Park Geun-Hye, who was dismissed in March 2017, but whose final conviction for influence trafficking and corruption was only rendered by the Supreme Court in January 2021. "The veredict in the first instance should be issued around August, but the case involves about 70,000 pages of evidence and numerous witnesses. If the court considers it necessary, the trial may be extended," France-Pressure Law agency told Mini Kyoung-Sic. Look back Among others, the court will hear the testimony of two army officers cited by the prosecutors, one of whom claimed to have received orders from their superiors "to withdraw deputies gathered at the National Assembly to impose martial law." On the night from December 3 to 4, 2024, Yoon Suk Yeol imposed the martial law unexpectedly, sending the army to block the opposition -dominated parliament. However, a few hours later, a high number of deputies managed to meet to vote for the survey of martial law, in a crisis that caught the country by surprise. If convicted, Yoon will be the third former South Korean president to be convicted of an insurrection after Chun Doo-Hwan and Roh Tae-Woo in 1996 by a coup in 1979. According to lawyer Min Kyoung-website, the court may apply to Yoon the jurisprudence of Chun and ROH trial, as its actions "also involved the coercive use of the Armed Forces."

item.title: Restoration and retail with recipe breaks in February
item.description: In February, retail trade volume suffered a 28.2 percent reduction in annual terms, measured by the volume of electronic payments. The data were revealed yesterday by the Directorate of Statistics and Census Services (DSEC). In the second month of the year, the turnover was 4.26 billion patacas. The highest reduction in business volume happened in the footwear, with a reduction of 37.3 percent, compared to February 2024. Another sector much affected by the decrease in sales was that of “warehouses and trinkets”, where the reduction reached 36.1 percent. Breaker Restaurants In restoration the situation was no different, with the volume of business, measured by the volume of electronic payments, to have a break of 8.2 percent in February, compared to the same period. In this respect, restaurants with Chinese food showed a reduction in 20.8 percent, the most significant turnover among different restaurants. The second most sharp drop affected the establishments with Japanese and Korean food, with a decrease of 6.7 percent, followed by fast food restaurants, in registered a decrease in 6.4 percent business volume. item.description: Zhong Kui, the student's patron is often represented on a strange creature that, observed from the tail, has a fish tail that becomes a dragon, a composite designated to. In imperial examinations, from the Tang dynasty to the Song, between 618 and 1279, the candidates who studied for the imperial exam, after completing it awaited the result on a staircase where the figure of one of these fantastic creatures was carved. What was first, the first to step on the head of Ao, originated a saying to indicate a successful feat-Duzhan aotou, "seize the head of Ao." The descendants of the emperor, during the Qing Dynasty designated in Manchu A-G, were not subject to this examination, but their study regime was no less demanding. Since three in the morning studying, among others the four books and the five classics, without vacation, with only five days free a year. One of the most brilliant heirs of this dynasty was Aisin-Tei Hongli, which between 1735-95 would occupy the throne of the dragon son with the name Qianlong. An episode of his biography confirms him when he impressed his powerful grandfather, Emperor Kangxi (1654-1722). He was then twelve years old when he first found him at the Pony Pavilion of the former Yuanmingyuan Summer Palace, the "Garden of the Perfect Brightness." At the time he recited by color the poem of Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073) in praise of the lotto, the flower that is born for beauty, indifferent to the sludge from where it comes. When in turn became emperor, the grandson remembered the grateful meeting with his grandfather named two places where he took place; The Peonial Garden Pavilion began to "the moon emerging, the clouds move away", and the place where he studied with him, "wind and pines between a myriad of valleys." Usually it also remembered the place by ordering the glorious morning painting during Guxian, the third lunar month (ink and silk color, 179.4 x 106.2 cm, at the National Palace Museum in Taipei). Yu Xing (1736-1795), born in the Yushan Hill in Changshu (Jiangsu), the author of this panel, was a painter of the qianlong court who had distinguished in thorough paintings from flowers, plants, insects and fish. In a horizontal roll that made under the theme fish and algae (paint and color on paper, 28.5 x 157.8 cm, sold on Sotheby's), Qianlong wrote a poem proving his appreciation: Green algae like jade scattered throughout the lake and fish swimming free between algae. This scene makes me think in the uselessness of our life. Observing the fish having fun gives me a great joy. The classic Zhuangzi states, without explaining the reason for words, that the life of the fish is really jublishing. And who knows if it is not this joy that is figured in the persistent representation of a fish that will fly, light and powerful as a dragon.

The “renewed” version that was born in 2013, announced in Kazakhstan, as a track and route (一带一路) at the initiative of the current Chinese president, XI Jinping (习近平), based on the principle of connectivity, aims to connect Asia, Europe and Africa through land and maritime routes. The country to maintain this statute, or perhaps even overcome it, needs to continue with its plan of 4 or 5 modernizations, maintaining the connection abroad for this purpose, that is, the Going Out policy has to continue. Thus transit a first phase of globalization, that of direct exports and foreign direct investment abroad (IDEE), for a second phase of globalization, as stressed Ilhéu (2018, 149) in the form of mergers and acquisitions in Asia, Europe and Africa, as well as in the Americas or Oceania. item.title: PAULO MAIA AND CARMO
item.description: Zhong Kui, the student's patron is often represented on a strange creature that, observed from the tail, has a fish tail that becomes a dragon, a composite designated to. In imperial examinations, from the Tang dynasty to the Song, between 618 and 1279, the candidates who studied for the imperial exam, after completing it awaited the result on a staircase where the figure of one of these fantastic creatures was carved. What was first, the first to step on the head of Ao, originated a saying to indicate a successful feat-Duzhan aotou, "seize the head of Ao." The descendants of the emperor, during the Qing Dynasty designated in Manchu A-G, were not subject to this examination, but their study regime was no less demanding. Since three in the morning studying, among others the four books and the five classics, without vacation, with only five days free a year. One of the most brilliant heirs of this dynasty was Aisin-Tei Hongli, which between 1735-95 would occupy the throne of the dragon son with the name Qianlong. An episode of his biography confirms him when he impressed his powerful grandfather, Emperor Kangxi (1654-1722). He was then twelve years old when he first found him at the Pony Pavilion of the former Yuanmingyuan Summer Palace, the "Garden of the Perfect Brightness." At the time he recited by color the poem of Zhou Dunyi (1017-1073) in praise of the lotto, the flower that is born for beauty, indifferent to the sludge from where it comes. When in turn became emperor, the grandson remembered the grateful meeting with his grandfather named two places where he took place; The Peonial Garden Pavilion began to "the moon emerging, the clouds move away", and the place where he studied with him, "wind and pines between a myriad of valleys." Usually it also remembered the place by ordering the glorious morning painting during Guxian, the third lunar month (ink and silk color, 179.4 x 106.2 cm, at the National Palace Museum in Taipei). Yu Xing (1736-1795), born in the Yushan Hill in Changshu (Jiangsu), the author of this panel, was a painter of the qianlong court who had distinguished in thorough paintings from flowers, plants, insects and fish. In a horizontal roll that made under the theme fish and algae (paint and color on paper, 28.5 x 157.8 cm, sold on Sotheby's), Qianlong wrote a poem proving his appreciation: Green algae like jade scattered throughout the lake and fish swimming free between algae. This scene makes me think in the uselessness of our life. Observing the fish having fun gives me a great joy. The classic Zhuangzi states, without explaining the reason for words, that the life of the fish is really jublishing. And who knows if it is not this joy that is figured in the persistent representation of a fish that will fly, light and powerful as a dragon.

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: The Guido Valadares National Hospital (HNGV) in Dili acknowledged the lack of assistance to a patient who died on Sunday at that hospital in Timor-Leste and will open an inquiry. "It is true that we recognize the lack of medical care and this may have led to the death of our patient, who had been hospitalized for almost a week," Vidal de Jesus Lopes, director of the HNGV diagnostic and therapeutic support service. Vidal de Jesus explained that the HNGV management has already received the report of doctors and nurses who have been service at night, and will create an independent team to investigate the case. "The patient died due to bleeding, but it is necessary to find out whether that was what caused death or if there was another reason," he said. According to the patient's family, an 81 -year -old man has always been assisted by trainees of the medical school. "It is true that there was a failure on our part, because our senior professionals should have supervised better. We will correct it," the hospital director acknowledged. The director of HNGV's diagnostic and therapeutic support service also stated that hospital staff always serve patients with “care, dedication and sense of responsibility”. "We recognize that any action of interns should be supervised by senior professionals. For the future, we take this responsibility and we will work so that situations like this do not repeat," he said. Vidal de Jesus also lamented that often patients already reach the hospital with very complicated health situations for which treatment is no longer possible.

item.title: Literature | Dora Nunes Gago closes Macau's trilogy with “gray flowers”
item.description:
Dora Nunes Gago, writer and former director of the Portuguese Department of Portuguese, has just launched a new poetry book. "Flowers of Gray" ends the trilogy of works dedicated to Macau, composed of "flowered by mistake the angry roses" and "Nomadic Words"
It was ten years that translated into many words. So many, who gave three books, “they were mistakenly flowered to the angry roses”, clearly reference to Camilo Pessanha; “Nomadic Words” and now “Gray Flowers”. Dora Nunes Gago's new poetry book, a teacher and former director of the Portuguese Department of Macao (one), also refers to Macau who lasts in his memory and, therefore, translates into words. With the seal of Humus, the book has just left Portugal, resulting from the "many poems" written by Dora Nunes Gago during the period in Macao, an experience that turned her into an published and award -winning author. Writing poetry in these years of teaching and experience the East turned out to be the way found to deal with Macau's reviliations and their dynamics. “Perhaps because it is a shorter record, a way to capture moments, of crystallizing them, in the midst of all the bullshit and surprises that Macau dresses. Maria Ondina Braga referred to the work“ Statue de Sal ”, written in Macao, around 1963, that Macau is 'sleep of sleep and poetry'. Hm. “Gray Flowers” ​​is called because he went to seek inspiration from a poem by Natália Correia: “(…) young people oblivious to the pulcitude of the body in celebration / pass me as cypresses of cypresses / And the youth gray flower is an edge / strike me by opening vacuums of wild flowers (…) / the gallop in a teeth foam.” Dora Nunes Gago selected the “surviving poems” of the remaining two titles of the trilogy. “There were those who were lost, between changes, travel, blocks and lost notebooks.” Like the whole macao's own revocation. In "Gray Flowers," the territory "is represented by rituals, the symbolic times like the Chinese New Year, which is that festive time when the world is reborn and inventing itself." There are also elements that become poetry such as the dumplings, the temples, the island of Hengqin, where the author lived in the days she taught at one. “The territory is present in the images, but also in the solitude and silence that inhabits the poems, all of them very short. In this book, my obsession with synthesis culminated,” he describes. Each book, a message There are poems that speak for themselves, others who need to be explained. And speaking of the trilogy he has written in recent years, Dora Nunes Gago refers to the first, where the pessanha symbolism is sought and where he denotes "the first look at Asia and Macao." Here there is no poetry, but 24 tales, "many of them inspired by witnessed stories, heard or read in newspapers." Already the award -winning “Nomadic Words”, winner of the Grand Travel Literature Prize Maria Ondina Braga last year, contains 50 chronicles. "It was the way to find a guiding thread to unite various experiences and learning that had a conductive thread for my life." Behold, in the last book of the trilogy, 55 poems, organized into three parts, namely “exhibitions, permanences and returns” are gathered. They are “a synthesis of all my route,” he says. “Gray Flowers” ​​is “Perhaps the most autobiographical book of the three, as it is rooted in multiple feelings, in a kind of instantaneous ones that configured my days,” says the author. From the preface, by Maria João Cantinho, it is read that the first of the trilogy, “flowered by mistake the Brave roses” is “a book of brief stories, whose title was taken from loan to a beautiful verse (and a poem) of the melancholy Camilo Pessanha, in Clepsidra”. While "nomadic words" brings together chronic chronicles that are born "from his experience in Macao, as well as his traveler and adventurous aspect, as the Teotónio Almeida needed very praised." In turn, in the third, Dora Gago "changes the record and we find ourselves in the face of poetic and sensitive writing, built by brief poems," he reads. Maria João Cantinho also understands that the poem “Destiny” is one of the most beautiful in “Flowers of Gray”: “In the crazy run / of the abandoned / lonely Galgo of existing, lick the wounds of death / in the skin of the poem.” Here, it is described “poetic writing is presented as vertigo (‘ in the crazy race ’) driven by a allegorical impetus, in which the presence of death emerges”, where “fate is certainly this disadvantaged race in which death surrounds the living and only the poem can save or redeem those”, considers Maria João Cantinho. For this, "Dora Nunes Gago's writing contains a reflective dimension, addressing topics such as the creation or passage of time, among many others, and using a rich, vocabulary and prosodic level language in the search for effects that accentuate the tension of the poem." “Exiles”, the first part of the work, starts with “beginning”, a simple name for a short poem: “I follow the memory footprints / inscribed in the sand of time / and I am a ship / anchored without leme / no breath”. Perhaps marked by longing and distance, we find “absence”: “They dance solemn ashes / Silvando Winds of Saudade, / Heavens / Spelled / In Blood / Solitude.” And as this book is made of comings and goings, the work ends with "return", as if it was a timeline: "Returning the house / tattooing hills and valleys / in the retina, / watering the flowers of gray / reborn / in stony cracks / of hope." Dora Nunes Gago is a native of São Brás de Alportel and is currently a teacher at the Setúbal Polytechnic Institute. About “Nomadic Words”, the Jury of the Grand Prix of Travel Literature Maria Ondina Braga, granted by the Portuguese Writers Association (APE), considered it to be a “work of varied and rich observations concerning the places where the reports of great sensory livelihood, which do not lack the intimate look at places and people designating as 'Génie du Lieu' ”. "In a prose of great fluidity, eavized of reflections where perceptions, memories, culture, literature and history are intersected, the author has been able to lead a reading reading from the first pages, whose rhythm and interest can maintain throughout the considerable extension of the work," said the same jury.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Checks, economy and great bay should be sam hu fai bets
item.description:
The government lines for this year are presented on Monday, marking the debut of Sam Hou Fai in one of the most anticipated moments of the local political calendar. Game recipes and economic predictions should be on the table, according to José Sales Marques and Lou Shenghua. The future of pecuniary checks may be another matter to be in attention
Sam Hou Fai has been in the government for almost five months and is preparing to present, next Monday, his first report of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year. Great expectations often reside in the amounts of pecuniary checks, the values ​​attributed to social support and other budgetary predictions, especially after the territory has been through a hard economic period with Covid-19. LAG 2025 should focus on these themes, and Macao's integration into the various regional cooperation projects, such as Hengqin Island or the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Fulfilling the annual tradition of local politics, Sam Hou Fai made the usual round of auscultations to local associations, in order to know his opinions on the main measures to take. Listened to by HM, economist José Sales Marques expects clarity in the policies announced at the economic level. "I would like to see these LAG bring greater clarity on economic policies and the vision for the future of MSAR. I speak of structural measures that encourage the trust of the private investor, and that also realize such reforms of public administration to increase efficiency and effectiveness," he said. Sales Marques also said that "I would like to clearly see Macao's positions and priorities in his relationship with countries and regions of the world, including measures that lead to deepen the role of Sino-Midfone and Multicultural Dialogue Platform." Lou Shenghua, a political analyst and professor at Macao Polytechnic University (UPM), said the main ideas presented will be in accordance with what Sam Hou Fai presented in the electoral program. "The tonic can be placed in improving the effectiveness of governance, moderate economic diversification, the construction of the Hengqin cooperation zone and the issues related to the subsistence means of people," said the analyst, stressing that "citizens may be more concerned with subsistence -related issues." And what program presented Sam Hou Fai in September last year, when it was glimpsed that he would be the only candidate for the position of Chief Executive? A program that has as its “maximum objective to meet citizens' expectations for a better life” and the “fundamental orientation of implementing the principle of a country, two systems” in a full, correct and firm way ”. The importance of national security was not forgotten, referring to the need for defense “of sovereignty, security and interests of the country's development”. About the sin, Sam Hou Fai said he wanted to erect a "macao based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." The then only candidate to head the government promised to improve the government's governing capacity. "We will strive to raise the capacity and level of governance of MSAR, the change in the concepts of governance, the optimization of the form of governance, the persistence of macao governance in accordance with the law, and the deepening of the reform of public administration and the legal system." Thus, he said "optimizing forms of governance, giving greater importance to the role of advisory bodies, experts and academics, and love associations of the country and Macao, widely listening to the opinions and suggestions of various sectors, different industry branches and various social strata." It remains to be seen if the lag will bring these tin aspects to the field of actions and concrete measures. MATE On Monday, the agenda continues as usual in the presentation of a report of the lag. First Sam Hou Fai will go to the Legislative Assembly, from 15h, make a general presentation to the deputies of political and budgetary issues essential for this year, following a press conference. The next day, it is a day of debate in the hemicycle on the same report, then followed the sectoral debates with all secretaries until the 30th of this month. One of the political themes that have been in the DAY ORDER is the value of pecuniary checks and whether or not they are attributed to residents living outside Macao. There are analysts to defend the reformulation of the program, but Sales Marques recalls that "the amount expected for pecuniary checks in the budget discussion for 2025 is 10,000 patacas for permanent residents." “Predicted budget revenues were based on calculation a gross revenue forecast of 240 billion patacas to an average of 20 billion per month. It turns out that the effective revenues obtained until the end of the first quarter of this year were short, with a deviation of less than four billion. be hit. ” Given these less optimistic predictions, referred to by the Secretary himself for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP last week, Sales Marques believes that, if there are adjustments in the checks, will be "small". "As for the distribution method, I predict that it remains the same," he said. Lou Shenghua believes that "the pecuniary reimbursement plan may change." "In terms of amount, it is likely to maintain the value of ten thousand patacas per resident, but regarding the form, it can be attributed to consumer valleys," he said. Last day 1, Secretary Tai Kin IP said the budget accounts are still short of expected. "We noticed that in the first three months of 2025 the gross revenues of the games reached 57.66 billion patacas, remaining the value almost unchanged in annual terms, not yet reaching the expected monthly average of 20 billion patacas." Thus, it was left the warning that "this year's financial revenues may not be as optimistic as it is expected", and it is necessary to "seriously study the future economic situation and persist in the management of financial resources with prudence." Game and other stories Regarding the game sector, which has continued to have a predominant weight in the economy, Sam Hou Fai confirmed a month ago that concessionaires and satellite casinos have until the end of the year to prepare the transition to a subconsers' exploration model. It will be in the "hands" of the dealers to decide whether or not to explore these casinos directly. For Sales Marques, this dossier “worries several sectors of society, not only about the use of its workers, but also for the repercussion that will close in the areas of the city where they are, especially in retail and restoration trade, small trade in general”. Thus, "it will be prudent to avoid great shocks in the current conjuncture." "Everything will be done to regularize these units under the law in force, without provoking their immediate closure," he added. Lou Shenghua hopes to “have room for negotiation about the distribution of revenues between the satellite casinos and the dealers”. Despite the concerns that reside in the unemployment of these people, Sam Hou Fai advanced in March to TDM that these fears can be removed. "I know that satellite casinos workers are distributed to the game companies, so operators have the responsibility of absorbing them or having plans for these workers," he said. Laws for I want you Given the history of Sam Hou Fai in court, as it has presided over the court of last instance since the establishment of the MSAR, some new measures can be expected in the area of ​​law. Sales Marques deposits expectations in the creation of new regulations “that are more facilitators to the operation of the economy”, quite “more favorable to the competitive business environment of this Great Bay region, namely as to the hiring of qualified human resources, conditions offered to their stay and that of their families and less bureaucratic administratives”. Lou Shenghua believes it could, in fact, “pay more attention to legal reform,” although it should be in accordance with government policies and follow the pace of times, not being reformed just because yes, ”he said.

item.title: Book | Mark O'Neill tells the history of Europeans in the early days of Hong Kong
item.description:
“Europeans in Hong Kong” is the 18th and new book by British writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, who lives in the neighboring region. At HM, he confesses that he began to write the history of the Irish, but the project eventually expanded. As such, it focused on the stories of Europeans who left their brand in Hong Kong, including Portuguese
Hong Kong, the city of banking, finance and commerce, a worldwide warehouse for centuries and a gateway to China. It has been the neighboring region throughout the time, since its institution, in 1841. Hong Kong has always been an international territory populated by Europeans of various nationalities, much more than the British who administered the territory until 1997. It was missing to tell its story, and British author and journalist Mark O'Neill, residing in Hong Kong since the late 1970s, now has it now with “European Europeans in Hong Kong], which even includes a chapter about the Portuguese. In another work that has just left the newsstands, the author confesses to HM who began to write the history of the Irish in Hong Kong, whose contribution to the "was huge" territory. This work was not published, being born later the idea of ​​doing something bigger. “I chose the figures that made the greatest contributions, especially at the religious level, or teachers, writers, great figures in the business world and those whose legacies still last,” he confessed. Mark O'Neill points out that the great contribution of Europeans in the neighboring region took place in the educational area, but not only. "The most lasting contribution was given by schools, universities, hospitals, homes of elderly, social assistance institutions and some companies. Although they are entities that are currently managed, largely, by people from Hong Kong, were founded and fueled by Europeans." The author explains that the most impressive story associated with the legacy of the French arises on the cover of the book. "In the nineteenth century, the French nuns adopted tens of thousands of Chinese girls who had been abandoned and gave them a good life. Without them, girls would have died or worked as child labor, maids or prostitutes," he said. Another house Asked about the new perceptions that the book can bring to the general public, Mark O'Neill understands that he is today "familiar with the history of British in Hong Kong, but not with the history of continental Europe." Thus, the author says he hopes that "the book will help them understand their history, especially their contribution." In general terms, "in the early decades [of the Hong Kong Foundation], Europeans were, above all, business men and missionaries, both Catholic and Protestants." Then the region grew “as a great Asian city and, from the 1950s, the community expanded.” "Currently, we have architects, engineers, musicians, teachers, restaurant owners, doctors, lawyers, art and people experts in all the domains of life," said the author. Another prominent figure in “Europeans in Hong Kong” is the Jesuit Hungarian Father Laszlo Ladany, considered the “China's greatest observer in the world for thirty years”, and Anders Nelson, “Swedish singer and long-standing resident in Hong Kong, well known to local inhabitants”, describes the introduction of the work. “Most people think that Hong Kong was built by the Chinese during their 150 years of British dominance, which is not entirely accurate. As the reader will discover, many of the schools, social assistance institutions, buildings and companies in the city were founded and managed by people from Europe (defined here as 'east of calais'). They forced it, ”is described in the same introduction. Mark O'Neill also describes that the Hong Kong cemeteries contain traces of this presence, as "Europeans have enjoyed the city and their people more than their homeland." The European presence increased in the neighboring region from 1949, when the People's Republic of China is founded, as "the new Chinese government closed the doors to foreigners, with the exception of a small number of people from other socialist countries." Thus, "eager to remain in China and in the Chinese world, many Europeans have moved from mainland China to Hong Kong," he is mentioned. The Macaense Legacy The fourth chapter is entirely dedicated to the Portuguese and Macaense Hong Kong community, regarded as a “pillar of society” for many years. “For 150 years, the Portuguese were, after the British, the largest non-Chinese community in Hong Kong,” reads the work, which draws the profile of five personalities and describes two social clubs where the community was. Regarding the personalities, the example of José Pedro Braga, the first Portuguese to be part of the Legislative Council, between 1927 and 1937; Sir Roger Lobo, member of the Executive Council between 1967 and 1985; and Commander Arnaldo de Oliveira Sales, first president of the urban council between 1973 and 1981. "The Portuguese played a key role in the government, in banks, the liberal professions and the commercial companies. They lived here for many generations. Most of the expatriates were only the time of their mission; when they renovated, departed and returned to Britain or another country in Europe. book. Regarding the origin of this community, it is described as a “mixed race”, or macanese, but also Portuguese with Asian origins. “Its history dates back to hundreds of years, in the early days of Portuguese trade and exploitation. In the 16th century, Portugal established commercial warehouses and religious missions in Goa, Malaca, Macau and Nagasaki. The Portuguese settlers married local women, creating a mixed root population in India, Malaysia, China and Japan. In 1639, the Japanese government expelled all foreigners and foreigners and isolated the country from the rest of the world. ” Macao emerges closely linked to this community, as it became, in the mid-16th century, “the basis of Portugal in East Asia” after the Dutch blocked Goa and won Malacca. "The Macanese began to form as a cohesive community-sharing ties with Portugal, the Catholic religion, a common language and kitchen and a feeling of distinction from the Portuguese colonials and their Chinese neighbors. They were the only people in Macao who spoke Portuguese and Cantonese, giving them a role of intermediaries essential for the proper functioning of government and business," he is explained. The fact that “the Hong Kong foundation has devastated the economy of Macao” made many macanese began to move from weapons and luggage to a much more brightly saving zone. After all, "just 66 kilometers away [Hong Kong] was the best deep water port in southern China within laws, administration and military protection in the largest empire in the world."

item.title: AL | Sam Hou Fai launches support for birth, but warns for budget revenues
item.description:
In his first lines of government action, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new “childhood subsidy” that will assign up to 18,000 patacas per year to permanent residents under three years. However, it warned of economic difficulties
In the first lines and government action he presented to the population of Macau, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new childhood allowance that will assign a maximum and 18,000 patacas per year to children under three years. In the Legislative Assembly, the Chief Executive revealed the creation of a new social support and the updating of others, underlined that the government places the well-being of the population as the great priority. Although it has only mentioned the “mitigation of population concerns” such as the third priority of the government's policies, behind other aspects such as the diversification of the economy and the efficiency of governance in the MSAR, Sam ensured that the population is the first priority: “The well-being of the population is fundamental. This government will persist in placing the interests of the population first and, taking into account the subjects related to their daily life, to solve the real problems. More pressing, with a view to responding to their aspirations for a quality life, ”he promised. As part of this policy, Sam Hou Fai has announced the support changes that are mainly intended to promote the increase in the birth rate and to support the elderly population or with special needs. At birth, the big news was the creation of the “childhood assistance subsidy” that will assign to each permanent resident child up to three years old an amount of 1,500 patacas per month, which can reach a maximum of 18 thousand patacas per year. This incentive is added an increase of 1,082 patacas from the birth subsidy, which rises from current 5,418 patacas to 6,500 patacas. Also the marriage subsidy is increased by 78 patacas, 2,122 patacas to 2,220 patacas. For the elderly At the level of support for the elderly, the elderly subsidy is increased by 1,000 patacas, rising from the maximum annual amount of 9,000 to 10,000 patacas. At the same time, the pension for the elderly is updated from a monthly amount of 3,740 per month to 3,900 patacas per month, a difference of 160 patacas per month. As this pension is paid thirteen times throughout the year, the maximum amount rises 2,080 patacas, from current 48,620 patacas to 50,700 patacas. Regarding residents with disability, normal allowance will be increased to 10,000 patacas per year, compared to current 9,000 patacas. The special disability allowance has a larger increase from the current 18,000 patacas to 20,000 patacas, a difference of 2,000 patacas. Another of the news is an update of health valleys, which will rise to 700 patacas, when they are currently 600 patacas. Economics warnings At the economy level, although without ever mentioning the new trade war between the United States and China, the chief executive warned that the Economy of the MSAR will not pass unscathed, although it can count on the interior market. "We have witnessed, in recent years, the aggravation of unilateralism and protectionism, the insufficiency of dynamics prone to world economic growth, as well as the increase of unforeseen events and uncertainties," he said. "Deep and complex changes in the internal and external environment have already manifested and will persist, so Macau, as a microeconomic strongly turned outside, could not be immune to the resulting impacts," he added. "For all this, we should not underestimate any threats and challenges, before, we must always be aware of the risks and a sense of warning, so that we are prepared to act against all potential threats," he warned. Sam Hou Fai also acknowledged that the current revenues are below the expected and that there may be a need to have a reformulation of the mashed budget in force. In terms of economy support, the government leader has announced a bank credit interest bonus plan for small and medium enterprises, which will allow entrepreneurs to obtain up to 4 percent of loan interest rates for three years, a maximum of 5 million patacas. item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like you minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. The EPM question In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several issues that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision taken under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, some ideas and opinions on “bilateral exchange and cooperation in the judicial, economic-commercial, education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The head of the executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [Fiscal Identification Number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

It is another visit of a Portuguese ruler to Macau, but Paulo Rangel's first as Minister of Foreign Affairs of the executive of Luis Montenegro, at a time when the country is preparing to go to votes in May after the dissolution of the Assembly of the Republic. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the positions of the European Union (EU) so fierce, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. of the EU, and this should not be lost sight of. ” Amelia António highlights the position that Portugal adopted in the case of Rede 5G and Huawei, but also “the development that occurred in relation to the coming of Portuguese to Macau, subject to Blue Card”. “I have the feeling that everything comes following this EU policy against China. Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. "We are here, we suffer the consequences of these relationships [between Portugal and China], good or bad. We had very close relations for a long time, which changed with Covid. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in macao immigration, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this removal” between China and the West. Macao authorities have not accepted new requests for residence in the territory for Portuguese for the “exercise of specialized technical functions”, allowing for justification of family reunion or previous connection to the territory. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "I would like the government of the Portuguese Republic to take into account the Portuguese community in the territory, which faces some difficulties regarding the possibility of obtaining the residence. The Portuguese community, due to greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still another community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In choosing correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one of green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration.
