item.title: Apomac | Jorge Fão regrets lack of people to manage association
item.description:
APOMAC - Macao's retirees, retired and pensioners association goes to elections tomorrow with a unique list. Francisco Mannão competes again for president, Jorge Fão for the General Assembly and Daniel Mendonça to the Fiscal Council. Mannão suggests the creation of a “satellite city” only for the elderly and calls for pensions update
Increasing the elderly pensions would be "gold on blue." In the meantime, Francisco Mannão continues to fight for this and other flags designed to improve the lives of older residents, again leading the candidate list for the management of Apomac - Macao's retirees, retirees and pensioners association, which take place tomorrow. The list is unique and the faces have little or nothing difference from previous years: Jorge Fão continues to lead the General Assembly, while Daniel Mendonça competes for the Fiscal Council. There is only one new name in the position of Member of the Fiscal Council. "It is very difficult to find people available to do this volunteer work. Jorge and I would like to find someone who could replace us, because we are for a long time in this association. We are elderly, but we have energy. As long as we have strength on the legs to walk, we are walking and trying to do our best by Apomac," Francisco Mannhão told HM. Jorge Fão highlights the fact that Apomac has been about to celebrate 25 years since the foundation, noting that there is, in fact, a leadership problem that if not solved can culminate in the disappearance of the association. "We are not seeing the emergence of another list of younger and younger people, so that we offer our services for another term and so on, as far as possible. There is a leading problem at Apomac and in other associations. The Apomac issue is more serious, because we have been standing for 24 years, we will celebrate in May." Satellite city and pensions In a list that will lead the association by 2028, the motto is “we are elderly but energetic”, reads in the action program. At the first point, it is indicated that the team's objective is "to monitor the government's policy and the Macau Foundation, with a view to adjusting the needs of our action program throughout this three -year term." In addition, they intend to "provide the necessary support to members so that they can enjoy the benefits awarded by the Government of MSAR and other official entities." One of the requests on the list to the government led by Sam Hou Fai is the increase in pensions, which is currently 3,740 patacas. It would be for the association would be the update to four thousand monthly patacas. "It would be good for the government of MSar to pay the pension monthly to the elderly, the pecuniary compensation and the old age, instead of having to wait every three months to receive the pension for the elderly, seven months to receive the pecuniary compensation and ten months to receive old age. Hm. Another idea left by Francisco Mannão is from the construction of a satellite city only for elderly dwellings, in what would be a larger project against residence for the elderly already built by the executive, in the area of ​​sand black. "I liked the Government of MSA to build a satellite city for the elderly. I worry a lot because there are many living alone, and with the construction of this satellite city they no longer have problems of loneliness, and could live with each other, and can provide services common to all. The construction of high buildings is good, but for the elderly it is not that good," he defended. Still, Mannão assures that being elderly in Macau is much easier than in Hong Kong. “Nowadays, in Macau, the elderly live quite well, because there are many social support attributed to this group of people. Sufficient resources Asked about the essential points to make Apomac a larger association, Francisco Mannhão says that “they have enough”, but lames the closure of the clinic where they were provided to the elderly health care. "Of course we had the plan to be able to develop our headquarters more, but due to the lack of the allowance we had to end our clinic. In this context, we had a program to develop this area that had to be abandoned, and that would benefit our associates. We tried to organize more lectures about health, because the senior group needs to know more about disease and health affairs, something that can generate great concerns." In political terms, Francisco Mannhão, who was even a candidate for deputy to the Legislative Assembly, says that Apomac is an advocate of the principle of “one country, two systems”, thought by Beijing to the regions of Macau and Hong Kong. "We agree with the national policy of 'a country, two systems', so that Macau can be a paradise for us. So far we have been quite well in Macau, we have no problems, but we would like this principle to continue." A lot of bureaucracy One of the services provided by Apomac goes through bureaucratic support to the elderly in communication with the General Retirement Caixa (CGA), in the case of former civil servants who receive the reform of Portugal, or the Macao Pension Fund. "The communication with CGA has improved a little, but the bureaucratic part is still very difficult to deal with on the part of our associates. Not long ago one of our associates has waited more than three years for an amount of an amount that was improperly charged," said Francisco Mannão. Jorge Fão, in turn, stressed that Apomac is also popular with non -partners, including from the Chinese community, to treat various issues, such as requests for subsidies or funeral -related paperwork. Still looking at the Action program, Apomac's list also aims to “organize more sightseeing tours to mainland China, making known its culture and success of the country”, as well as the promotion of “more coexistence, so that members join periodically”. Much sought after by the dining service, since in Apomac some dishes of macanese gastronomy can be eaten, the list wants to "improve the management of the canteen whenever possible." Asked if many elderly from Macau want to pass the renovation in China one day, at a time when regional integration is increasingly a reality, Francisco Mannão admits yes, although many “prefer to stay in the territory, as they have their life rooted here, being used to the uses and customs of Macao”. "The Government of MSA has been doing a lot of work so that they can join the great bay," he said.

Portugal | Sam Hou Fai visit after the legislatures Sam Hou Fai gave more data about his official trip to Portugal, the first of his term. “I hope the visit will happen after LAG, in the first half, perhaps after the legislative elections [on May 18], when the situation is more stable. We have Portuguese jurists working in the government and doctors, and also at the Portuguese Macao School there are teachers. We have no problem."

item.title: Press | AJM concerned with lack of communication

"AJM is seriously concerned about the fact that such a passive and regressive communication approach can become the new normal," he was nominated. “Once again, we appeal to the Government of Misrem that honor his promise of respect for press freedom, taking concrete measures: dialogue with the public and the media with more confidence, so that the community has a better understanding of their policy and vision,” was asked. AJM also regrets that journalists have ceased to be invited to cover some events that were normally covered, such as official visits to the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macao, or traditional visits by the Chief Executive during the fourth day of the Lunar New Year. In relation to the latter, the association indicates that the government only invited “two media” with connections close to the executive. Irrational refusal In the statement, the AJM also addresses the situation of the media in places that are being barred from the press conferences organized by the government. item.title: Tariffs | Authorities accompany impact on tourism
item.description:
Donald Trump's fares do not yet decrease the optimism of tourism services in the face of the number of tourists to reach the MSAR. However, if the situation changes, the authorities are ready to respond with other forms of promotion
Macau's Director of Tourism Services (STD), Maria Helena de Senna Fernandes, said the region is aware of the potential impact on the confidence of the Chinese tourists of the tariffs imposed by the United States. United States President Donald Trump announced a 90-day suspension of what he called “reciprocal tariffs,” including a 10 percent base tariff for all countries except for China, which imposed total 125 percent tariffs. However, yesterday, it was made public that several countries and regions will not be affected by tariffs. “At the moment we are observing what is happening. Of course we have to always be very attentive,” admitted Senna Fernandes. Hours earlier, the Macao Study Center and the Department of Economics of the University of Macao (one) rode the forecast for the region's economic growth in 2025 to 6.8 percent, 1.1 percentage points than in the previous forecast, made in January. Project coordinator and economist Kwan Fung said the low review is due to the decline in the consumption of visitors and the "US world tariffs," something that "has an indirect impact on Macao's economy." Kwan said the rates will "affect the growth of all economies, especially the consumption of mainland tourists." Macau Chan Chi Shing's study center has warned that tariffs will have a “huge impact on the Chinese economy” and may force many factories and companies to close doors, which would lead fewer people to visit the region.
Analyze The STD director said that "not yet" fears a reduction in the number of tourists in Macao, but admitted that "the situation can change." "If necessary, we have to adjust our promotion. So far, we are continuing with our promotion, which we had already planned," explained Senna Fernandes. The new government leader, Sam Hou Fai, will present today its first lines of government action for the year 2025. But Senna Fernandes said that in the tourism sector the priority will continue to be “capturing international tourists”, participating in fairs abroad and organizing activities in the territory. The STD director recalled that Macau will host in June the semi -semi -sectional meeting of the European Confederation of Travel Agency Associations and Tourist Operators and, in December, the Annual Congress of the Portuguese Association of Travel and Tourism Agencies (APAVT). APAVT is still organizing a European delegation, with “about 20 people”, which will participate in the 13th International Expo of Tourism (Industry) of Macao (Mite), April 25 to 27, said Senna Fernandes. Portugal will have its own space in Mite, which will also include, for the first time, the “Coffee Station” section, to “highlight the characteristics of Portuguese -speaking countries,” said the leader.

item.title: Alert for lower consumption of tourists with devaluation of Renminbi
item.description: The president of the Tourist Industry Association, Andy Wu, estimates that the consumption of tourists visiting Macau may be reduced due to the devaluation of Renminbi. The position of the representative and entrepreneur of the sector arises following the recent breach of the Renminbi exchange rate, which has reached the lowest point since 2010, leading to the US dollar indexed currencies, such as Pataca and the Hong Kong dollar, become more expensive in the exchange rate. In the background, the currency front in the Washington and Beijing trade war made Macau even more expensive for Chinese tourists. According to yesterday's exchange rate a Renminbi was worth 1.09 Patacas. However, Andy Wu faces the volume of tourists verified during the prolonged weekend of the Cheng Ming holiday as a good indicator that the number of visitors, which was above 130,000 a day, is not being affected by the trade war. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, the associative leader added that Macau, as a tourist city, always faces foreign exchange variables that influence the local economy on a large scale. As such, at this time, Chinese tourists can adopt a more prudent posture when opening their wallet. The official highlights the increase in pressure on the turnover of the retail sector sector, which has faced a deep crisis since the end of the pandemic, forcing various support measures launched by the government. On the other hand Another possible hard blow to Macao's economy, originated by the devaluation of Renminbi, is the fact that products, travel and stays in China have become cheaper for residents of Macau and Hong Kong. Regarding Easter holidays and Labor Day at the end of April and early May, Andy Wu expects Hong Kong tourists to compensate for the possible lack of visitors from the interior of China, where Easter is not celebrated and is not a holiday. However, May 1st is a golden week with five days of holidays in China. During this period, Andy Wu foresees the annual increase of visitors compared to the same period as 2024.

item.title: The psychology of attraction at first sight
item.description: "Attraction at first sight" is a phenomenon that fascinates everyone. The romantic comedies portray her as an instant and uncontrollable moment between two people. It is now necessary to unravel the possible explanations behind this phenomenon, resorting to two major schools of thought: cognitive psychology-which develops empirical methodologies to test hypotheses on the subject-and the psychodynamic approach-that works with interpretative bases. Both perspectives build metaphors that help us interpret these processes. Thus, we can oscillate between two proposals: will at first glance be a product of deeply rooted unconscious mechanisms or, on the contrary, a posteriori romantic construction, based on sensory and cognitive processes? Cognitive psychology suggests that "attraction at first sight" can result from rapid processing of sensory and emotional information. The human brain is programmed to recognize standards and categorize information efficiently, allowing us to evaluate someone in fractions of second, based on facial traits, expressions or body language. Studies on social perception confirm that we formulate immediate judgments about others. From a biological point of view, this phenomenon may be linked to activation of the dopaminergic system, responsible for the regulation of pleasure and reward. When we find someone we consider attractive, the brain releases dopamine, triggering a desire for proximity. In addition, investigation into pheromonas indicate that we are unconsciously attracted by partners whose immune system complements ours, favoring genetic diversity in descent. On the other hand, the psychodynamic approach, rooted in Sigmund Freud's psychoanalysis, explains the attraction at first sight through unconscious mechanisms. From this perspective, past experiences - especially those of childhood - shape our standards of attraction. When we feel instantly attracted to someone, it may be because this person acts memories or emotions associated with primary linking figures such as parents or caregivers. Attraction does not focus on the other as a real person, but in the way he resonates within our unconscious structure of desire. The other can symbolize something we lack, something interdict or an emotional issue not yet resolved. This mechanism, known as projective identification, explains how we can feel a strong attraction to someone who unconsciously represents significant parts of our psychic history. According to this theory, we rarely fall in love with those who really are, but by the way we project in it our unresolved emotional needs. The attraction is therefore a meeting of unconscious, where both project family standards in each other. Of course beliefs also shape romantic expectations. If we believe that instant attraction is a sign of destination, we tend to attribute to it emotional meaning. The impact of culture and social norms shows how the perception of “love at first sight” can be influenced by romanticed narratives. For example, in books, movies or advertising romanticizes the idea of ​​attraction at first glance, creating a narrative that leads people to idealize and expect intense and immediate emotional links. This cultural expectation can influence the way we interpret real encounters-if someone lives in tune with romantic ideals, it is more likely to attribute emotional meaning to an instant attraction, facing it as something "intended to happen" or "predestined". Cognitive psychology faces the phenomenon more pragmatically, almost stripping it of its romanticism: it all depends on our mental processing and what we consider relevant. Psychoanalysis, on the other hand, articulates the cross between fantasy and reality, proposing that although the attraction at first glance is composed of projective and fanciful elements, they are not totally dissociated from the meeting itself. There is something significant in this dynamic; Otherwise, people would not fall in love. As a psychoanalyst would say, we are attracted to those who can nourish our psychic wounds-which later may reveal the cause of dysfunctions in the couple. There is an intangible domain that subtly communicates who we are, where we have come from and how we can complete. In short, while neuroscience and cognitive psychology highlight automatic and hormonal reactions, psychodynamics emphasizes the role of unconscious and past experiences. Although cognitive and psychodynamic psychology can seem opposite-one focusing on conscious and observable processes and the other in unconscious and emotional mechanisms-there is potential for overlap, and recognizing it could make explanation more robust. The cognitive perspective on attraction, which emphasizes rapid and automatic judgments based on physical signals and emotional responses, can be understood as the initial and superficial processing that is complemented by unconscious processes. But my proposal is another: show that the way we look at the phenomenon affects the way we live it. Each explanation can better adapt to each person's experiences. Is the attraction at first glance rooted in an authentic and deep desire, or is it an illusion fueled by the human need for connection and meaning? The answer may reside in each other's imagination and wealth. Ultimately, the way we interpret the phenomenon of “attraction at first sight” can be deeply influenced by the brain and unconscious mechanisms discussed, but also by the cultural narratives we internalize. Thus, experience will always be an intersection between what we feel and how we learn to feel.

item.title: Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (II)
item.description: Last week, we debated the Independent Commission Against Corruption of Hong Kong (HKICAC) (Hong Kong Against Corruption Committee) and Hong Kong International Academy Against Corruption (HKIAAC) (HGO KONG ACADEMY AGAINST CORRUPTION) and we introduced their origins succinctly. Macao Commissioner against Corruption, (CCAC). In 1975, during the Portuguese administration of Macao, the fight against corruption was carried out by the Judicial Police. In 1992, the then government of Macao created the High Commissioner against corruption and administrative illegality. Referring to Hong Kong's experience, which had become one of the most impollowing places in the world, when writing Macau's Basic Law, it was clearly stipulated that CCAC would have to be created. The CCAC website underlines the committed work it develops to review the law and strengthen the fight against corruption. One of the most illustrative cases is that of Man Long: “Investigating the case of corruption A to Man Long began in 2005, when during the investigation of a corruption case based on information available in the meantime, CCAC found that the then secretary for transport and public works was involved in suspicion of abuse of power. He will have accepted bribes of large construction entrepreneurs and the winners of major government works are indicated.” (In April 2007, the first phase of the inquiry against Man Long was completed. It was found that, during the time of the secretary, his heritage reached a total of 800 million patacas, ie, 57 times higher than the remuneration of the position. Objects. On January 30, Tui ordered Man Long for 57 crimes of passive corruption, whitening, abuse of power and others, to the prison penalty of 27 years and the payment of compensation of 240,000 Patacas to the Government of the Government, being declared in favor of the government all assets from illicit acts.). This shows that CCAC has achieved extraordinary results in its work to combat corruption. In 2006, the International Association of Anti-Corruption Authorities (Iaaca) was created in Beijing. It is the first international anti-corruption organization in the world with agencies from various member countries. It aims to actively promote the “United Nations Convention against Corruption” and reinforce international cooperation between counterparts from various countries. Cao Jianming, Attorney General of China's Supreme Popular Attorney's Office, was elected president of IAACA twice, on November 5, 2010 and November 24, 2013. The mandate of the IAACA President is three years. On January 5, 2022, the Commission Commission Commission against Hong Kong Corruption, Ba Yunliu, was elected as a new president. Later, Ba Yunliu retired. On September 1, 2023, Hu Yingming assumed the position of president of IAACA. IAACA has a “Federation Secretariat”, created by HKICAC on January 6, 2022 to support the HKICAC Commissioner in the exercise of his duties as president of IAACA. The main responsibility of the Federation Secretariat is to support or organize activities. HKIAAC is affiliated with the HKICAC International Cooperation and Institutional Affairs Division and performs part of the federation secretariat's duties. Hong Kong Chief Executive John Lee believes that, in addition to cooperating with China's work and anti-corruption policies, HKICAC also cooperates with organizations around the world to jointly promote the global anti-corruption cause. HKICAC can help improve the fight against corruption in Hong Kong, promote the region's unpolluted environment and promote the stability, integrity and rule of law of Hong Kong society. Currently, HKICAC has already trained in over 70 countries. In February 2024, HKICAC coorganized a “International Anti-Corruption Course on Financial Investigation and Pursuit of Fugitives and Stolen Assets”, lasting nine days, in collaboration with the “Operational Network of Agencies for the Anti-Corruption Law of the United Nations Drug and Crime Law”. In March 2024, HKICAC opened a five-day anti-corruption course for more than 90 employees from the “illegal enrichment office” in Mali, covering topics such as research techniques, integrity management and public education. In early April 2024, HKICAC sent staff to Kazakhstan in Central Asia to conduct courses to nearly 200 local anti-corruption agencies. In May 2024, HKICAC signed a memo of cooperation with the United Nations and Crime Operational Network of Application Agencies. In May 2025, it assisted it in the writing of the “Prison Corruption Risk Management Guidelines”. A HKICAC spokesman pointed out: “HKICAC values ​​operability that combines theory with practice, actively fulfills its anti-corruption mission, builds an international platform for integrity, promotes the development of the anti-corruption cause globally, and unequivocally contributing to its advancement worldwide.” HKICAC has provided several anti-corruption formations in many countries and worked hard to combat global corruption. These achievements were made under the leadership of China. From now on, HKICAC will not only continue to compete with this work, but its existence will speak for the history of China and Hong Kong. item.title: Music | Sound bands of Hayao Miyazaki classics live on Londoner
item.description:

Fans of director Hayao Miyazaki, composer Joe Hisaishhi and animated studio Ghibli will have the opportunity to listen to the main songs in the movies “The Mononoke Princesses”, “My neighbor Totoro” and “Castelo in Heaven”. The Studio Ghibli Symphony concert is scheduled for April 26, Saturday, at the Arena of the Hotel and Casino Londoner. The group of 18 musicians coming from Japan will be accompanied by the original singers of the soundtracks of the Japanese director. One of the main highlights is Contractor Yoshikazu Mera, who at 53 is one of Japan's best -known Western classical music singers. For this media, he contributed the fact that in 1997 he was chosen to sing the soundtrack of the movie “The Mononoke Princesses”, and especially the theme “Mononoke Hime”, made up of Joe Hisaishi. Azumi Inoue will be another of the Japanese stars taking the Londoner stage. The singer has gained great notoriety in the Japanese country with the songs "Sanpo" and "My Neighbor Totoro" of the 1988 film. item.title: Photography | António Leong show at Creative Macau from April 24
item.description:
Creative Macau will show from April 24 “Déjà Vu”, an exhibition of photography by António Leong. With the city as a background, the show brings together black and white images of everyday moments that evoke a sense of nostalgia and family memories
In the exhibition “Déjà Vu”, each image captured by António Leong's objective acts as “a portal, apprehending fleeting and stagnant moments that resonate the essence of Macau. These images bring us memories of past incidents, meetings and personal narratives in which Macau serves as a backdrop. This is how Creative Macau describes the photography exhibition of António Leong “Déjà Vu”, which will be evident to the public between April 24 and May 12. “Each photograph of this collection has captivated my attention for long periods, inspiring a deep sense of admiration and calm. It is a pleasure to be able to share with the public the comfort they provided me. I sincerely hope that they can also experience their greatness,” says the photographer, quoted by a statement from Creative Macau. The face and contours captured in the photographs of “Déjà vu” contrast with a game of shadows and light. "The lines, shapes and silhouettes used aim to convey the supernatural nature of these themes in the context of our contemporary world," adds the photographer. The organization of the event describes the exhibition of António Leong as an evocation of “nostalgia through a series of black and white photographs, capturing silent narratives that took place in Macao in recent years”. From the internet to the gallery António Leong's relationship with photography is a longtime passion, coupled with the fascination of the aesthetics of the city that saw him born. Macau's cultural dualities have been one of the photographer's inspiring muses, which began to share images on social networks, namely on the Facebook page that created in 2012 - Antonius Photoscript. The online exhibition has opened it to doors and opportunities to participate in various photographic exhibitions that promote Macao tourism worldwide, but also to cooperate with different charity organizations and artists in various types of photographic activities. Time and experience led him to participate in acts as an instructor and speaker, sharing his techniques and photographic experiences. In 2021, António Leong and the Macao Cultural Catholic Association presented together the exhibition “discovering the beauty of everyday life”, and in 2024 presented “Via Pulchritudinis: Macao Catholic World Heritage.” Creative Macau enhances the fundamental role of photography in the documentation of reality without prejudice, where the aesthetics of the image is significantly shaped by the perspectives and angles chosen by those who take the photography. In this show that it will be evident to the public from April 24, the feeling of Déjà Vu is “uninterruptedly evoked through the clicks of the photographer's Chamber Lens'. “From the intricate details of architecture to the vibrant tapestry of people's daily interactions, images can incorporate both familiarity nostalgia and the enthusiasm of the city's discovery,” he is added.

item.title: Pollution | SMG recommend to the population to avoid going out on the street
item.description:
The high concentrations of pollutants in the air throughout yesterday led the authorities to alert the population to avoid going out on the street or practicing outdoor exercise
Macao's displaced dust for a northeast monsoon led the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) to appeal to the population to avoid leaving home. Throughout the day, air quality levels were varying, but for most of the time they remained at levels classified as dangerous. "Under the influence of a dust storm brought by a northeast monsoon, and due to weak wind and unfavorable meteorological conditions for the dispersion of atmospheric pollutants, it is expected that the concentration of pollutants will remain at high levels for a period of time," SMGs were explained by the alerts issued to the population. "SMG advise the population, especially people who suffer from heart or respiratory disease, pregnant, children and the elderly, to avoid strenuous activities and outdoor activities, especially in areas of intense traffic," he was added. Regarding the general population, around noon, it was indicated to reduce “strenuous activities and the time of outdoor permanence”. According to the authorities' analysis, the different pollutants recorded different levels of concentration throughout the day, a factor that also depends on the place where the measurement is made. However, around 12:35 pm, the concentration of particles 2.5, also known as fine particles, ranged from 74 to 81 micrograms per cubic meter. The World Health Organization (WHO) guidelines indicate that healthy levels of PM2..5 should not be above an average of 5 microgram per cubic meter throughout the year. In addition, the WHO indicates daily exposure to a value of 15 microgram per cubic meter, should not exceed more than four days. High values Regarding PM10 particles, around 12:35 pm, concentration levels ranged from 272 to 368 micrograms per cubic meter. According to WHO, the healthy limit value of the average daily concentration of these particles is 50 micrograms per cubic meter and the annual limitation value is 20 micrograms per cubic meter. At the level of nitrogen dioxide the recommended maximum levels are 25 micrograms per cubic meter per day and 10 micrograms per cubic meter per year. The measurement of SMG at 12:35 pm yesterday, which was based on the values ​​of the previous hour, indicated a concertation of 39.1 to 88.9 micrograms per cubic meter. It was not only at Misrem that the impact of the dusts displaced by the monsoon was felt. Yesterday morning, Hong Kong appeared identified by the portal IQAIR.com as the place with the fourth worst concentration of air pollutants worldwide. Raehk was only outdated at the worst air quality level by Shenzhen, the neighboring city of the interior of China, Nova Deli in India and Lahore, Pakistan. Around noon, Hong Kong fell to sixth place, having been overtaken by the Chinese cities of Guangzhou and Chongqing, which also had a large concentration of pollutants in the air.

item.title: Encounter | Apomac without hope of seeing problems solved
item.description:
The President of the Apomac General Assembly, Jorge Fão, received José Cesário, Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities, but admits that problems such as the extension of passports to 10 years or the implementation of an effective system to do the life will continue without solution
The President of the General Assembly of Apomac - Association of Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners of Macao claims to have no hope of solving the problems of the Portuguese in Macau related to the consulate, proof of life or extension of the validity of passports. This is how Jorge Fão commented yesterday's meeting with the Secretary of State for Portuguese Communities, José Cesário. "He [Cesário] knows what our concerns are, but they are not resolved, because Portugal has a very weak economy, not a rich country, and the Portuguese living outside Portugal, and especially outside Europe, have dies of problems. And Portugal cannot solve these problems," Jorge Fão told HM when asked about the presentation of the problems of the Portuguese community. "He knows the problems better than anyone, worked many mandates as deputy and secretary of state, knows better than any secretary of state the situation. But, the problems have been solved so far?" He asked. Jorge Fão recognized that he lost hope after successive governments of Portugal. "I never hope to solve the problems. I have already lost the desire to wait, in fact I lost confidence, faith and lost everything," he admitted. "Whoever, I think Portugal is very turned in and out, the Portuguese from Macau, Canada or Brazil, or wherever, just to acquire the nationality takes years. If there is a Portuguese child born abroad, to acquire Portuguese nationality only the procedure takes three years," he exemplified.
With “beards” The associative leader explained that the problems with greater impact go through the waiting time in the processes of recognition of Portuguese nationality, the increase in the validity of the passport from five to 10 years, the proof of life for the reformed that does not work and always has to be repeated, a “old -fashioned” computer system in the consulate of Portugal, as well as lack of personnel and wage updates to the workers of the consulate. Jorge Fão guarantees that these problems mentioned yesterday at the meeting with José Cesário, but were not new. "These problems have all beards," he said. In turn, the secretary, according to Fão, left no promises of resolution: "He does not promise, because he knows what the situation is like. How will he make promises if this is not just about him?" He said. "When a government does not work, it cannot be expected to be a secretary of state to work the rest," he said. With Portugal having new elections for the Assembly of the Republic on May 18, and with José Cesário leading the AD list, currently in power, in the circle outside of Europe, Fão indicated that the matter was little approached, but that he did not fail to tell Cesário that he considers him favorite. "He has not touched much in his [electoral] program, but I think he is prepared for what comes from the electoral act. I think he is convinced that he will win, and probably will," he said. "I am not seeing the existence of another strong competitor. To this day it has not yet appeared," he said.

item.title: Astronomy | Brazil wants to help Macau's reference laboratory
item.description: The Brazilian National Institute of Space Research (INPE) wants to help the State Reference Laboratory for Chinese Lunar and Planetary Science in Macao, exploiting asteroids, yesterday told Lusa an astronomer. IP Wing-huen, a member of the Academic Committee of the Macao University of Science and Technology Laboratory (Must), revealed that the institution invited Inpe and received a positive response. “We came into contact with Brazilian planetary scientists and asked if they would be interested in working with us about asteroids. (…) They are very interested,” IP explained. In addition to Brazil, the Macao laboratory, known as SklPlanets, also wants to cooperate with researchers in Portugal, taking advantage of the presence in the must of Portuguese Marta Filipa Simões, Professor of Astrobiology. “I spoke to the rector [of Must] Lee [Hun-Wei]. He said there is a window we could open for cooperation” with Brazil and Portugal, defended IP Wing-huen, who grew up in Macao. "Macau has its own historical heritage, which cannot be reproduced by any other city anywhere else in China and is something to explore," said the astronomer, referring to the Portuguese administration of the region. IP, which received in 2020 the Gerard P. Kuiper career prize of the American Astronomy Society, spoke on the sidelines of a lecture at Must about the efforts to explore asteroids. Other flights The scientist revealed that the SklPlanets laboratory is considering participating in the mission of the European space probe Ramses, which will “try to land and travel” at Asteroid Apophis, which is expected to pass by Earth in 2029. Astronomers have ruled out any risk that Apophis hit the planet over the next hundred years, because “we have been accompanying it for decades, because, when it comes to asteroids, having time is very important,” said IP. The investigator recalled that in early February, local press said China began gathering a planetary defense team following the discovery of a large asteroid that could reach Earth within seven years. This after the European Space Agency (ESA) estimated 2.2 percent the probability that the Asteroid 2024 YR4 reaches the Earth by 2032, placing it at the top of the agency's risk list. Weeks later, ESA descended the likelihood of impact to 0.002 percent, but set the likelihood of an impact on the moon at 1.7 percent, which remains “very low”. "Earth can only be hit by a significant asteroid in 100 years or a thousand years, but how early we detect them, better," said IP. In addition to detection, the astronomer stressed the importance of planetary defense missions such as Dart of the US Aerospace Agency, NASA, which in 2022 intended in an asteroid. “We have to experience how to get away from Earth, because asteroids are usually surrounded by smaller objects, it's almost like hitting a sandbag,” IP explained.

item.title: Restoration and retail with recipe breaks in February
item.description: In February, retail trade volume suffered a 28.2 percent reduction in annual terms, measured by the volume of electronic payments. item.title: Macao Orchestra | Operational losses reach 54.2 million
item.description: The Macao Orchestra recorded operational losses of 54.2 million patacas last year. The results were presented yesterday by the company and represent an aggravation of accounts of 16.7 million patacas within one year, since in 2023 operational losses had been 37.5 million patacas. In terms of revenues, official data show that last year there was a climb to 67.7 million patacas, compared to 49.6 million in revenues of 2023. However, the Macao Orchestra even made less money with the organization of concerts and shows, since in this chapter the revenues were 34.4 million patacas, when the previous year had been almost 34.9 million patacas. At the opposite pole, the sponsorship revenues of the season, which includes services provided to game dealers, grew to 30 million patacas, when the previous year had been only 10 million patacas, a difference of 20 million patacas. Still in the chapter of revenues, the interest of the money deposited in local banks generated 2 million patacas, a growth, while the “other revenues” were 516,000 patacas. In both cases an increase was recorded compared to the previous year, where revenues had been 672,000 patacas and 40,000 patacas. Business costs In terms of expenses, the highest costs were due to payments to musicians, with the expenses to be 54.2 million patacas, a growth of about 10.2 million patacas, within one year. These also joined 9.6 million patacas, for guests, which also represented an increase compared to the 7.3 million patacas of the previous year. In addition to these payments, the second largest expense aimed at organizing the orchestra concerts that were 31.2 million patacas, more 14.5 million than the previous year. The third large share of expenses was due to the ordinances of the company's employees, worth 12.4 million patacas, a growth of 3.4 million compared to 2023. Although expenses were higher than revenues, the company did not damage due to government subsidies. Last year, the total value was 54.2 million patacas, an increase compared to the 37.5 million patacas from the previous year. More concerts and visitors Over the past year, the Macau Orchestra Activities report shows an increase in the number of concerts and also the public. In 2024, the Macau Orchestra organized 113 concerts, 25 more than the previous year, which attracted 63,500 visitors, a growth of 17,000 people. Already the Chinese orchestra of Macao, organized 117 concerts, four more than the previous year, with the audience to be 31,200 people, a growth of about 4,400 people.

item.title: Infertility | 340 subsidy requests received
item.description: Between December, and until March, the authorities received 340 requests for financing of medically assisted procreation treatment. The data were released by Health Services (SS), in the context of the statistics of the reimbursement program in the treatment of medically assisted procreation. According to the Chinese channel of Radio Macau, Chio Weng, the head of the Administration Department of the Conde de São Januário Hospital Center indicated that 240 candidates passed in the preliminary clinical evaluation. They will now be sent to Macau Union Hospital for the second phase of evaluation. SS estimates that there are about 200 cases of infertility and sterility per year. Currently, only Kiang Wu Hospital offers in vitro fertilization service, but it is expected that Macau Union Hospital also offers the service in the second half of this year. As part of the subsidy of this program, each couple can receive medically assisted procreation services for a maximum period of two cycles, limiting the “in vitro” fertilization techniques-first generation or intracticoplasmic injection of second generation (ICSI) sperm injection (IVF). The scope of rate exemption covers the assessment of infertility in the external consultation of infertility, the IVF / ICSI cycle and the diagnosis and treatment of the respective complications.

Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses everything? How many will not be abandoned to what it is? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. item.title: The yo -yo
item.description: O my friends, companions of these funerals trips to countries as old as the stars and the moon, and as strange as the profound interior of our disgraceful souls, - that startle still awaits us, what secret spells we will have to overcome, what horrors will rise to our dilated pupils of amazement and terror? Increasingly close to our precarious existences, howling the war monster, which threatens to merge humanity with the earth, incessantly traveled by the squalid spectrum of hunger and the invisible evil of ten thousand pests. O human human, who cries superior to his own nature, but then reveals to you, once and again, unable to simply order your existence and do not understand that you are possessed by the fickle wrath and are slave to your own ambition! Do not be content with the white jade or the light gold, there is no treasure that gives you your inextinguishable thirst for other men, animals and things; for in you an eternal anguish in you; in you crawl the expelled snakes; For you grows, powerful and impossible, the very fertile ivy of evil! item.title: Timor-Leste | Reference Hospital opens inquiry into the death of sick
item.description: The Guido Valadares National Hospital (HNGV) in Dili acknowledged the lack of assistance to a patient who died on Sunday at that hospital in Timor-Leste and will open an inquiry. "It is true that we recognize the lack of medical care and this may have led to the death of our patient, who had been hospitalized for almost a week," Vidal de Jesus Lopes, director of the HNGV diagnostic and therapeutic support service. Vidal de Jesus explained that the HNGV management has already received the report of doctors and nurses who have been service at night, and will create an independent team to investigate the case. "The patient died due to bleeding, but it is necessary to find out whether that was what caused death or if there was another reason," he said. According to the patient's family, an 81 -year -old man has always been assisted by trainees of the medical school. "It is true that there was a failure on our part, because our senior professionals should have supervised better. We will correct it," the hospital director acknowledged. The director of HNGV's diagnostic and therapeutic support service also stated that hospital staff always serve patients with “care, dedication and sense of responsibility”. "We recognize that any action of interns should be supervised by senior professionals. For the future, we take this responsibility and we will work so that situations like this do not repeat," he said. Vidal de Jesus also lamented that often patients already reach the hospital with very complicated health situations for which treatment is no longer possible.

item.title: South Korea | Former President denies insurrection
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol denied yesterday having committed any insurrection acting during the attempt to impose martial law in December "To describe an event that lasted just a few hours, which was not violent, and immediately agree to describe the request for dissolution of the National Assembly as an insurrection (…) it seems legally unfounded," he said before the central court of Seoul, which after two preliminary hearings began to judge the case, which could result in a Yoon Suk Yeol conviction or even the death penalty. Untited by the Constitutional Court on April 4, after being suspended from office in mid -December, Yoon now faces criminal accusations. Despite the heavy penalties to which he was subject, he is free, and his pre-trial detention was annulled by procedural reasons on March 8. Like all defendants, the former head of state had to start by saying his name, date of birth and home. The incriminating accusation Yoon Suk Yeol of “wanting to provoke a revolt, with the aim of overthrowing the constitutional order”, noting that the martial law was prepared in advance and that orders were given to the army to cut electricity and depart the parliament windows. Yoon, former Attorney General, elected head of state in 2022, began to refute the point charges by point. Most experts expect the process to be long, making comparisons with former President Park Geun-Hye, who was dismissed in March 2017, but whose final conviction for influence trafficking and corruption was only rendered by the Supreme Court in January 2021. "The veredict in the first instance should be issued around August, but the case involves about 70,000 pages of evidence and numerous witnesses. If the court considers it necessary, the trial may be extended," France-Pressure Law agency told Mini Kyoung-Sic. Look back Among others, the court will hear the testimony of two army officers cited by the prosecutors, one of whom claimed to have received orders from their superiors "to withdraw deputies gathered at the National Assembly to impose martial law." On the night from December 3 to 4, 2024, Yoon Suk Yeol imposed the martial law unexpectedly, sending the army to block the opposition -dominated parliament. However, a few hours later, a high number of deputies managed to meet to vote for the survey of martial law, in a crisis that caught the country by surprise. If convicted, Yoon will be the third former South Korean president to be convicted of an insurrection after Chun Doo-Hwan and Roh Tae-Woo in 1996 by a coup in 1979. According to lawyer Min Kyoung-website, the court may apply to Yoon the jurisprudence of Chun and ROH trial, as its actions "also involved the coercive use of the Armed Forces."

item.title: Xi says protectionism does not take anywhere, before Asian ride
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping considers that protectionism “leads nowhere” and that a trade war “will not produce winners,” the local press said before the leader visits Vietname. Xi will hold this week a journey through Southeast Asia to reinforce his country's business relations and try to reinforce confidence in China as a trusted partner, unlike the United States, who have launched a global commercial offensive. The Chinese president will move to Vietname, Malaysia and Cambodia, where he will meet with his counterparts, according to the Chinese Foreign Ministry. These are the first international visits of Xi Jinping this year. "Our two countries should firmly safeguard the multilateral commercial system, the stability of global industrial and supply chains and an international opening and cooperation environment," wrote Chinese leader in the Vietnamese newspaper Nhan Dan, according to the China official news agency. "A commercial war and a tariff war do not produce winners, and protectionism leads nowhere," he said. The visit of the Chinese president occurs at a time when the Asian country is trying to emerge as a stable partner in contrast to the United States, whose President Donald Trump launched a commercial offensive with new customs fixed at 145 percent over Chinese products, excluding some exemptions. This measure shook the world markets and led Beijing to retaliate. Vietnam is negotiating a 46 percent reduction in US tariffs, which, after the 90-day temporary suspension announced by Trump, could take effect from July. Xi Jinping arrived yesterday at Vietnam, where he should stay two days, on his first trip to the neighboring country since December 2023. The two countries maintain strong economic relations. However, they are regularly disturbed by territorial disputes in the Southern Sea of ​​China, particularly due to competing claims of the Paracels archipelago. China claims almost all of the southern sea islets, while the other coastal countries (Philippines, Vietname, Brunei, Malaysia) have rival claims. It's talking Xi Jinping guaranteed in an article published in a Vietnamese newspaper that Beijing and Hanoi are able to resolve these disputes through dialogue. “We must manage disputes properly and safeguard peace and stability in our region,” wrote XI. "With our vision, we are fully capable of correctly resolving maritime issues through consultations and negotiations," he said. Xi underlined the need for Beijing and Hanoi to “reinforce coordination” in various sectors, such as education, agriculture, infrastructure and technology. During his visit, the second in less than 18 months, the two countries will sign about 40 bilateral agreements on a wide range of issues. China has been Vietnam's main commercial partner for over two decades and, by 2024, bilateral trade has exceeded $ 260 billion (228 billion euros), according to official data. In recent years, Vietnam, the once USA historical enemy, has approached Washington with the aim of diversifying its exports, the country's main economic engine. During Trump's first term (2017-2021), many companies moved from China to Vietname to avoid the tariffs imposed by the United States on Chinese products.

item.title: Tariffs | Beijing asks Washington Fair dialogue and based on respect
item.description:
China has stated that Donald Trump's fares harm the international economic and commercial order and appealed to Washington to "solve problems through a fair dialogue based on mutual respect." Despite everything, Chinese exports rose 12.4 percent in March
"We urged the United States to immediately correct their wrong approach and to resolve business differences through dialogue," Lin Jian's Ministry of Foreign Ministry spokesman said yesterday. Lin stated that "the US puts its interests ahead of the common good of the international community, which is a typical example of tariff intimidation." The spokesman reiterated that "in a trade war no one wins" and that "protectionism offers no way out." The trade war triggered by Trump intensified on April 2, with the announcement of "reciprocal tariffs" against the rest of the world, a measure rectified one week later, in the face of the fall of markets and the increase in US debt financing cost. But while softening his offensive with most countries, applying a widespread 10 percent tariff, he decided to increase rates on China, which are now set by 145 percent. However, this weekend, Washington has decided to exempt many Chinese technological products. Trump said on Sunday that semiconductor rates will be implemented “in the near future” and will announce the rates later this week as part of his trade war. On Sunday, China classified the exemption of tariffs on certain Chinese electronic products such as "a small step" for the United States to "correct their wrong practice" and urged Washington to "completely cancel" rates. For Beijing, US tariffs "not only violate economic and basic market laws, but also ignore complementary cooperation and the offer relationship-search among countries." Orders and Orders China exports increased 12.4 percent in March, in homologous terms, as companies rushed to complete orders before the tariffs imposed by the President of the United States, Donald Trump. Imports fell 4.3 percent, according to data released by China's customs administration. According to the same source, exports from the world's second largest economy increased 5.8 percent over the first three months of the year, compared to the same period last year, while imports fell 7 percent. China's commercial surplus with the United States was $ 27.6 billion in March, with Chinese exports increased by 4.5 percent. In the first quarter of the year, the Asian country registered a surplus of $ 76.6 billion in trade with the US. Given the rates applied by the White House to Chinese products, it should be noted that the highest increases in exports were to Southeast Asian countries, which saw imports from China jump almost 17 percent in March, in relation to the same period. Exports to Africa increased more than 11 percent. Chinese President Xi Jinping left yesterday to Vietnam (see secondary text), as part of a journey that also includes Malaysia and Cambodia, aiming to reinforce commercial ties with other Asian countries that also face heavy tariffs, although last week Trump delayed their application for 90 days. China's exports to Vietnam increased almost 17 percent last month, compared to March last year, while imports fell 2.7 percent. Liu Daliang, spokesman for the Chinese customs administration, said China faces a "complex and severe external situation," but "the sky will not fall." Asked about the fall of Chinese imports, Liu told journalists that China has been in a row for 16 consecutive years the second largest importer in the world, increasing its quota of global imports from about 8 to 10.5 percent. "Currently and in the future, China's import space is huge and the big Chinese market will always be a great opportunity for the world," he said.

item.title: Timor-Leste | Dili receives interministerial meeting of G7+
item.description: The capital of Timor-Leste will receive tomorrow and Saturday the sixth ministerial meeting of the G7+ that will first join the heads of the organization's diplomacy, which marks 15 years of existence. G7+ is a forum in which member countries seek to influence global discourse on peace, stability and resilience, as well as define joint actions to achieve those objectives. The Intergovernmental Organization was established on April 10, 2010, in Dili, and emerged with concern, shared by its Member States, that traditional development cooperation did not improve the situation of fragile nations. "The purpose of this meeting, the sixth G7+ministerial meeting, is to reflect on the progress achieved during the 15th anniversary of its establishment," said G7+Secretary-General, Helder da Costa. The meeting, which traditionally brings together the ministers of the finance, planning or economy of the Member States, will first join the heads of diplomacy in several countries because of “global politics”, to make a “reflection on the script for the coming years” and because G7+ has an “increasingly global voice”, said Helder da Costa. The meeting, co-organized with the Timorese Foreign Ministry, begins exactly with an intervention by Timorese Prime Minister Xanana Gusmão about “safeguarding peace in turbulent times: the vision of G7+”. The meeting will also make a presentation on the organization's path over the last 15 years and a debate on cooperation between the Member States. The G7+ has a Observer Statute to the UN General Assembly since December 2019 and in the community of Portuguese-speaking countries since July 2021. Afghanistan, Burundi, Central African Republic, Chad, asres, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Guinea-Concrite, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Liberia, Papua-Nova Guinea, Sao Tome and Prince, Sierra Leone, Somalia, South Sudan, Timo-Leste, Togo and Yamen G7+Member States.

item.title: Tariffs | Japan says negotiations with USA include exchange rates
item.description: Japanese finance minister Katsunobu Kato yesterday indicated that the exchange rate between the dollar and the yen will be on the table in negotiations with the United States about tariffs. Kato has confirmed what analysts have been suggesting, based on the priority objective of the United States to reduce trade balance with countries with which they have deficit and to which tariffs -which he calls reciprocal -like Japan. "There have been several communications with the American side, including over exchange rates, and then movements in the exchange markets may be among the topics discussed, although the details have not yet been determined," Kato said in a speech in the Japanese parliament. The leader also explained that discussions about the exchange rate will be held among the finance ministers of both countries. The Japanese government announced on Tuesday that the minister responsible for economic revitalization and new capitalism, Ryosi Akazawa, will be Tokyo's main representative in tariff negotiations. Washington, in turn, appointed the duo graduated by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and commercial representative Jamieson Greer to lead the team.

item.title: Visit | Praised Spain's role in the approach of China to the EU
item.description: China yesterday highlighted the positive role Spain is playing in improving Beijing and the European Union, in a context of growing commercial tensions between China and the United States. "The ties between China and Spain maintain strategic stability and are based on the opening, cooperation and mutual benefit," said Foreign Ministry spokesman Lin Jian yesterday at a press conference in Beijing, where the head of the Spanish government, Pedro Sánchez, has planned to start an official visit tomorrow. The spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has described Spain as "an important European economy and a fundamental cooperation partner within the European Union." The trip takes place in a period of climbing the trade war between China and the United States and after the Chinese Prime Minister, Li Qiang, spoke to the president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen. The two leaders committed to defending free trade and reinforcing the role of the World Trade Organization (WTO). Sánchez will be received in Beijing by Chinese President Xi Jinping and will have meetings with the Prime Minister, Li Qiang, to diversify export markets, reinforce economic ties with Asia and face global challenges such as climate change and war in Ukraine.

item.title: EU | Chamber of Commerce in China says companies should rethink strategies
item.description: The European Union Chamber of Commerce in China said yesterday that the customs of 104 percent imposed by the United States on Chinese products "require a strategic rethink of business models and supply chains." The institution said in a statement that the fees will lead to “substantial increases in operating costs” and “inefficiencies”, which ultimately will mean “higher prices for consumers”. Many of the companies that are members of the House have already changed or are changing their trade strategies to a “China for China” model. "This is both to mitigate the risks arising from commercial tensions and to meet China's regulatory and acquisition requirements, which increasingly promote" Made in China "products as for commercial reasons," the text added. According to the institution, in a context where the United States are "retreating in many of the principles that have sustained its global commercial approach, generating unprecedented global economic uncertainty," China now has "the opportunity to establish a business environment that provides the stability and reliability that investors need."

item.title: Tariffs | Xi Jinping defends reinforcement of ties with neighbors
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday appealed to the “reinforcement of strategic ties with neighboring countries” in his first public appearance since Donald Trump increased to 104 percent customs at China. XI, who did not mention the US President, urged his employees during a working meeting to improve relationships with neighboring countries “through proper management of differences”, with a view to “reinforcing ties in supply chains,” said the official news agency Xinhua. China's relationships with neighboring countries are “at their best level in modern history” and at the same time Beijing is “in a crucial phase deeply interconnected with changes in regional dynamics and global developments,” he noted. The Chinese leader argued that China's diplomacy with his neighbors will be based on the construction of a “shared community”, one of the most repeated phrases by Chinese Communist Party leaders (CCP) in which it is argued that prosperity is only sustainable if nations work together. At the meeting, it was also stressed that China should reinforce its sense of responsibility and maintain a “neighboring, sincerity, mutual benefit and inclusion. Difference management It has also been underlined that China should "support countries in the region to maintain their own development pathways and correctly manage conflicts and differences." "We must build a high -level interconnection network and reinforce cooperation in industrial and supply chains," added the Chinese leader, stressing the importance of "maintaining regional stability and cooperating in matters and law enforcement." The Chinese leader has not made any reference to the United States and Beijing has been underlining so far that he will not give in to Trump's rates. Trump ordered on Tuesday to apply an additional 50 percent rate on Chinese products, raising total customs rates to 104 percent. Beijing previously announced a 34 percent rate on US products, after Trump imposed a rate in the same percentage on Chinese products, and announced yesterday an increase of 50 percent at the imposed rate, now totaling an 84 percent tariff. In the possible future negotiations between Beijing and Washington is also the future of Tiktok's application operations in the US, which Trump's government has demanded that it disconnect from its mother company, Chinese Bytedance, to be able to operate in US territory. Plus 50 percent China announced yesterday an additional 50 percent retaliation rate on imports from the United States to 84 percent, intensifying the trade war between the two largest economies in the world. The Chinese Ministry of Finance said the new rates apply beyond the 34 percent previously announced on US imports. The rates come in today.

item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. It is also a matter of survival for local universities. Yes. Perhaps there is no greater example of a catalyst for the diversification of Macau's economy than higher education. We have ten institutions, 60,000 students in about 700,000 inhabitants. This is the potential of internationalization, to foster diversification.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. Pode haver uma ideia, mas depois não se intervém em todas as dimensões necessárias para atingir um certo objectivo. But I am very optimistic. Acredito que essa nova política para estudantes é um passo chave a ser tomado em Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. The CCCM welcomes this initiative in Portugal, but we also work with the Portuguese Catholic University. And concrete results, already have it? We have a number of small initial projects that are starting now, and we also work with many business organizations. We have now negotiated a series of projects, and I think everything will develop very quickly, based on the manifestations of interest we have. We were in Angola in December and we have already aligned a series of initiatives, we also have projects with Brazil and Portugal.

item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”

The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution

It is this reality that we see a little away from school. And after the pandemic, how has it been? I think we will take a few more steps towards digital literacy. With Artificial Intelligence (IA), it seems that we are as in the phase I created my first website in 1999 or email in 1995. We are at the beginning. But it is 30 years of technology where there have been many changes, and technology in fact goes on and if we immediately do not realize what we have available, we and students, we help create a moat that has happened in the past compared to digital. In the face of AI, if we do not look back and do not realize what was not done and should have been at school level, we are wasting time. Only a few years from now will people be alert to AI, and the gap is increasing. Hence it is very important to bet now, in this early stage, in the training of teachers, students and families. Is there much ignorance of parents, removal from this reality? We have parents who are from this century. That is, they were born with the existence of computers, internet, saw the appearance of the smartphone. But when they studied, the school did not talk about the potential of digital. So these former students came to society and did not bring this sensitivity to digital, to educate their children. We teachers, when we do digital training, are doing good to society because we are also preparing these young people for the future, because they will be parents and should be aware of educating their children. At school we do not only prepare for the job market, but for personal and family life. Hence teacher education is essential. The invitation I received from IPOR seems to me an excellent holistic view of everything, because the school includes several actors, connecting with society. How should AI be introduced into the classroom? We currently watch changes in search engines, in fact. We have search engines created from root to Age Age, for example. The best way to introduce AI into the classroom is to ask students and how they use it, and already resort to this tool. At the beginning of the academic year I always ask students to answer a questionnaire about their digital routines, and then I know more or less their practices. In 2023, when the chatgPT came out, I introduced AI in my classes, and realized that students were using this tool to deceive the teachers. Students have to realize that when using AI, they are falling into a certain trap because they are not learning. It is the law of the lowest effort, equal to the phase in which the internet emerged, when students selected, copied and sent to the teacher. We now have the problem that the answers are in Brazilian Portuguese, for example, and see as soon as I was used. We have, therefore, to dismantle this action in the heads and face them. I tell them that they are being intellectually dishonest and that they have not read the AI ​​response, for example. Since 2023, I feel that students, in the answers to this questionnaire I do, say they are afraid to use chatgpt because they are afraid of being caught by teachers. That is, it seems to have gained some conscience. It will give these lectures in a different educational context in Asia, where the use of mobile phone can be earlier. How will you deal with these differences, or do you understand that the problems of using technology in the classroom are transversal? It is a transverse question. Do we have to wonder if the use of a particular equipment and tool will make us wiser? It seems to me not, because we may have the equipment, but the use we make it varies a lot. I tell my students that they should be ashamed, because they have much easier access to content than in my time, when we truly had to do research and read in physical format. I tell them that with this technology they should all have a grade 20, and that they are wasting resources, being dishonest intellectually, because they sign works that are not theirs and do not read, even, they deliver. One of the works we have with students is to teach them how to make bibliographic references, refer to the sources. But I am an optimistic by nature, and I hope that in a decade, secondary education students who are fathers and mothers will be able to deal with these problems of social networks and increase fraud with their children. It is this “parents school” that the school can help create. We are in a moment with no return of digital, and forbidding is the most comfortable situation, but it is not the best to face reality. We have to use the right words to alert. We have in this time of alerts and consciences, encouraging the critical spirit of our students, which is little today.
